clues.text: Eggnog latte is most associated with this holiday season (& don't say eggnog season!)
The Swiss water process is a popular way to remove this bitter stimulant from coffee
Yum!  In May 2000 this chain introduced its Chocolate Brownie Frappuccino
Sumatra Mandehling, one of the world's finest full-bodied coffees, comes from this country
This word that refers to a tiny coffee cup or the coffee served in it means "half cup"
The name of this ceremonial form of Japanese suicide means to "cut your belly"
Yiddish for "a gossipy woman", it's derived from a woman's name
A Chinese form of self-defense, its name means "work man"
Spanish for "little war", it's a member of a small band of irregular soldiers who harass the enemy by surprise raids
This French phrase for a death blow given to put one out of his misery literally means "stroke of mercy"

rounds.comments: (Alex: We will name a ship in literature; you have to name the skipper.)

clues.text:
1851:
The Pequod

1932:
The Bounty
(before the mutiny)

1870:
The Nautilus

1951:
The Caine
(before the mutiny)

1904:
The Ghost

This word can mean a small heavenly body as well as a young actress headed for fame

We've all gotten a little older since this CBS soap premiered in 1973
Term for the period in English history after the 1660 return of the house of Stuart

2-word medical condition describing an abrupt cessation of heartbeat

This character's maiden name was Lovey Wentworth

Thinking home is no "paradise", Cathy fakes her own death & runs away in this classic Steinbeck novel

Anti-gang laws target this, defined as hanging around or moving too slowly
This adjective often found before "exposure" means the exposer knows others can see
From the same root as consecration, this opposite term is sometimes done to flags
In 1931 Al Capone got 11 years not for murder or bootlegging but for this
These creatures also called prawns may feed on krill, their fellow crustaceans
This krill-eater similar to the octopus has 8 arms & 2 tentacles
A 1910 rhyme called Boston "The Home of the Bean" and this krill-eating fish

This krill-eating whale got its name because it seemed like the proper or correct one to hunt
Long before it was newburged or thermidored, it was so plentiful it was a food for the poor
Virgil wrote "Latet anguis in herba", "A snake lurks in" this
Of a place in Massachusetts, a tuna salad or 2 glasses pressed together, what Sandwich glass is named for

Its address is 3764 Elvis Presley Blvd.
Before dialing M for Monaco, she was born in Philadelphia on Nov. 12, 1929
Proverbially, "There but for" this "go I"
A co-pilot of the Jefferson Starship
Sean Hayes is "just Jack" on this sitcom

[President Shot At Buffalo Fair]

Month & year of the historic headline seen here:
[Stocks Collapse in 16,410,030-Share Day But Rally At Close Cheers Brokers Bankers Optimistic, To Continue...]
Losers reported on Oct. 16, 1964 included the Yankees in the World Series & this ousted Soviet leader

rounds.text: In 1859 a theory was born when he wrote, "from so simple a beginning endless forms... have been, and are being, evolved"
